metadata.title: CVE-2014-3578 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in Pivotal Spring Framework 3.x before3.2.9 and 4.0 before 4.0.5 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary filesvia a crafted URL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3578` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspring-aop-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-beans-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-context-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-context-support-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-core-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-expression-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-instrument-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-jdbc-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-jms-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-messaging-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-orm-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-oxm-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-test-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-transaction-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-web-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-web-portlet-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-web-servlet-java - 3.2.12-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libspring-java package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.12-1').
